Text saved: Human rights are basic freedoms that all people should have.  
Wasfia gave her life to support human rights.  
She saw many help projects in her country.  
These projects taught women and girls.  
But often the projects stopped.  
When they stopped, the women got nothing.  
Wasfia saw Bangladesh needed to help itself.  
So she mixed two passions: climbing and human rights.  
She wanted to change how people view women.  
She started climbing while working on help campaigns in Tibet and Nepal.  
Bangladesh is a flat country by the sea.  
Most people have never seen a mountain.  
Her project is working.  
Other people in Bangladesh are paying attention.  
People around the world are also noticing.
Feedback received: Grade 1/10 - FAIL
